review: I purchased this due to the apps that it had.  I do not have a smart TV.  I was impressed right after the install.  The device was programmed with my account information and jumped right into a tutorial when it booted up.The only effort I had was signing into my Netflix account.
author: Amazon Customer

review: As a Prime member it seemed a shame to 'waste' the Prime video component that comes with the Prime membership. I chose the Stick over the more expensive console Fire TV strictly as a matter of cost, and I have not been disappointed. I literally plugged it into my HDTV and in the time it took to change input lines on the remote, the Fire Stick was up and running. Video and audio quality are excellent (as is the system its hooked into). With lots of free content from Amazon, its already paid for itself in saved purchasing costs. Getting this is a no-brainer.
author: BearPup

review: A couple of months and I am happy with the Fire TV stick. There are a ton of apps and games. Most apps work great. I have an occasional problem with Sling TV but 95% of the time it functions properly.Apps that I've downloaded and watch regularly: Netflix, HuluPlus, Amazon Prime TV and Movies, Twitch.TV (cool!), IGNSetup was a breeze. It took me about 5 minutes.  My reason for buying the Fire TV stick was price, app availability (Some competitors are missing Apps that I want), and portability (you can move it to different rooms in the house if you want to. It's also impressive that there is 8GB of storage and a fast processor on this device. Space is good for downloading apps and games. Processor speed is good for switching and loading apps. The remote is pretty simple but simple is sometimes better. I am pleased so far!
author: Amazing Ethan

I use it every single day.
